dt: {bc}a player in a sport (such as football) assigned to a {a_link|defensive} position

et: Middle English {it}defendour, defender,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}defendour, defendur,{/it} from {it}defend-,{/it} stem of {it}defendre{/it} "to {et_link|defend|defend}" + {it}-our, -ur{/it} {et_link|-or:1|-or:1}
shortdef: a player in a sport (such as football) assigned to a defensive position

dt: {bc}a lawyer usually holding public office whose duty is to defend accused persons unable to pay for legal assistance

shortdef: a lawyer usually holding public office whose duty is to defend accused persons unable to pay for legal assistance
